abstract.p: Proceedings in Indian Parliament are disrupted for second straight day as opposition parties demand resignation of Narendra Modi, chief minister of Gujarat State that has been racked by worst religious violence between Hindus and Moslems in decade; photo (S)

block.p: Proceedings in Parliament were interrupted for the second straight day as opposition parties demanded the resignation of Narendra Modi, the chief minister of Gujarat, a state that has been racked by the worst religious violence in a decade. Mr. Modi is a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party, the Hindu nationalists who lead the nation's ruling coalition. Support for Mr. Modi has begun to drive a wedge between his party and some of its most important political allies.
